questions.questionText: How many stars are in the Chicago flag?
questions.explanation: The four stars represent: Fort Dearborn, Chicago Fire, World's Fair: Columbia Exposition and last but not least, the Century of Progress Exposition.

questions.questionText: What type of pizza is Chicago known for?
questions.explanation: The classic Chicago Deep Dish pizza was created in Pizzeria Uno in 1943.

questions.questionText: What does the checkered flag signify in races?
questions.explanation: Once this flag flies, all drivers must past under the flag in order to have their finishing position scored.

questions.explanation: In 1947, William H.G. France organized a meeting with racing enthusiasts in Daytona Beach, Florida, leading to the creation of NASCAR. The first official NASCAR race took place in 1948 on Daytona Beach. Since then, the sport has grown significantly, with millions of fans tuning in to watch races every year.
